articles.description: Today at Collision Conference we unveiled breaking new research on the economic and productivity impact of generative AI–powered developer tools. The research found that the increase in developer productivity due to AI could boost global GDP by over $1.5 trillion.
articles.title: The economic impact of the AI-powered developer lifecycle and lessons from GitHub Copilot

articles.author: Jaroslav Lobacevski
articles.description: Introducing a new tool to monitor and control the permissions of the repository token for GitHub Actions.
articles.title: New tool to secure your GitHub Actions

articles.author: Andrzej Mazur
articles.description: Highlighting 13 of the top games plus source from the latest Gamedev.js jam–by GitHub Star and event organizer, Andrzej Mazur.
articles.title: Open Source challenge results from Gamedev.js Jam 2023

articles.author: Martin Woodward
articles.description: Explore the impact of non-code contributions—and why they are often undervalued, the challenges of using open source in regulated environments, and the art of managing projects at the scale of Kubernetes, now on The ReadME Podcast.
articles.title: Bridging code and community

articles.author: Joshua Brown
articles.description: The new GitHub Code View brings users many new features to improve the code reading and exploration experiences, and we overcame a number of unique technical hurdles in order to deliver those features without compromising performance.
articles.title: Crafting a better, faster code view

articles.author: Rizel Scarlett
articles.description: In this prompt guide for GitHub Copilot, two GitHub developer advocates, Rizel and Michelle, will share examples and best practices for communicating your desired results to the AI pair programmer.
articles.title: How to use GitHub Copilot: Prompts, tips, and use cases

articles.author: Mike Linksvayer
articles.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) recently proposed rule changes that will make it harder to challenge low quality patents. Without the ability to quickly and efficiently challenge wrongly granted patents, innovation and developers suffer.
articles.title: Developers need the right to challenge junk patents

articles.author: Justin Young
articles.description: GitHub’s redesigned navigation is enabled for all users as a public beta.
articles.title: Exploring GitHub with the redesigned navigation, now in public beta

articles.author: Sylwia Budzynska
articles.description: Learn the basics of CodeQL and how to use it for security research! In this blog, we will teach you how to leverage GitHub’s static analysis tool CodeQL to write custom CodeQL queries.
articles.title: CodeQL zero to hero part 2: getting started with CodeQL

articles.author: Jakub Oleksy
articles.description: In May, we experienced four incidents that resulted in degraded performance across GitHub services. This report also sheds light into three April incidents that resulted in degraded performance across GitHub services.
articles.title: GitHub Availability Report: May 2023

articles.author: Inbal Shani
articles.description: We surveyed 500 U.S.-based developers at companies with 1,000-plus employees about how managers should consider developer productivity, collaboration, and AI coding tools.
articles.title: Survey reveals AI’s impact on the developer experience

articles.author: Jeff Guerra
articles.description: GitHub’s VIP Bug Bounty Program has been updated to include a clear and accessible criteria for receiving an invitation to the program and more. Learn more about the program and how you can become a Hacktocat, and join our community of researchers who are contributing to GitHub’s security with fun perks and access to staff and beta features!
articles.title: GitHub’s revamped VIP Bug Bounty Program

articles.author: Kate Higa
articles.description: The accessibility-alt-text-bot leaves automated reminders in a comment when a user shares an image without providing meaningful alt text.
articles.title: Make your GitHub projects more accessible with accessibility-alt-text-bot

articles.author: Tim Rogers
articles.description: With GitHub Enterprise Importer, you can seamlessly move to GitHub Enterprise Cloud, bringing your code and collaboration history with you so your team doesn’t miss a beat.
articles.title: Cloud migration made easy: introducing GitHub Enterprise Importer

articles.author: Abby Cabunoc Mayes
articles.description: Maintainer Month is a time for open source maintainers to gather, share, and be celebrated. Over 31 days, 16 organizations came together to offer 42 activities convening and celebrating maintainers.
articles.title: Maintainer Month 2023: How the community gathered to spread some maintainer love

articles.author: Gwen Davis
articles.description: Explore how investing in a better developer experience frees developers to do what matters most: building great software.
articles.title: Developer experience: what is it and why should you care?

articles.author: Demetris Cheatham
articles.description: Take part in All in for Maintainers' new pilot program that helps open source project maintainers highlight ongoing efforts in advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion within their communities.
articles.title: Announcing the All In CHAOSS DEI Badging pilot initiative

articles.author: Walker Chabbott
articles.description: We’ve launched the beta of code scanning support for Swift. This launch, paired with our launch of Kotlin support in November, means that CodeQL covers both IOS and Android development languages, bringing a heightened level of security to the mobile application development process.
articles.title: Swift support brings broader mobile application security to GitHub Advanced Security

articles.author: Zack Koppert
articles.description: A tool to help you keep your open source catalog organized and up to date.
articles.title: Announcing the Stale Repos Action

articles.author: Chris Reddington
articles.description: Could we use our Git repository as the source of truth for operational tasks, and somehow reconcile changes with our real-world view?
articles.title: Applying GitOps principles to your operations

articles.author: Klint Finley
articles.description: Experts explain how to recruit and onboard co-maintainers.
articles.title: Elevating open source contributors to open source maintainers

articles.author: Taylor Blau
articles.description: The open-source Git project just released Git 2.41. Take a look at our highlights on what’s new in Git 2.41.
articles.title: Highlights from Git 2.41
